Thanks be to God through Jesus Christ, who spoke into your hearts with an organ and persuaded them that the study of religion, which is so flourishing and celebrated throughout the world, should not fail.What will the devil leave undone, by which he might make true piety foreign and idolatry come back?
Now I see that Capiton could not persuade, though he tried many times, that it would be in the truth that you, the Zurich people, would be more necessary than the Bernese, though my heart is so devoted to you that I would think the most difficult things easy for you, my brother and friend.I have informed my brethren of the illustrious victory, who sadly hear that Zurich has come to this, that it wanted to turn the substance of the college to war or treasury use.

Obsecro te iam tercio, si quid in epistolam ad Romanos congesseris, per Rellicanus ad me mittas.Eam hactenus pro contione nunquam tractavi, tractandam tamen assumam propediem.Si quid ex illo tempore, quo sum profectus, habes, quod ad me mittas, utendum est Rellicano.
Rellicanus will come to you.What is written between us, namely you and me, should not be shared.With him I will return what you sent.The good and studious man has made up a quarrel with me, as if I had taken care to be loved by us.The Senate worked for Melchior Volmar, a very learned man teaching Greek at Byturiges.He himself has borne this with difficulty, yet he has dissimulated it so far.He certainly has an equal worth in price to us, but a far different labor, which I certainly favor well, provided he would also make himself a participant of other church affairs, which he has refused so far.For the Senate had asked him to take up the position of preaching, should any of ours be ill, which he refused.But enough of this.Write to me through him.
It is murmured from the Senate and the people that they want to admit again the dances, games and I don't know what other rustic meetings, which have been prohibited so far in the dedications.Show me, I beg you, what should be done and with what reasons we can dissuade them effectively.For it would open the occasion and license of all evils.
I had written through Walther Schwiger.I don't know if the letters have been returned.If they have been, answer them, if not, I will write again, which Capito has indicated in two letters.
Things are going well with us and I wish it were as constant as it is well.For constancy and diligent execution of matters are always desired by us.For too many business easily impede the diligence of those who are otherwise negligent.
I beg you for the third time, if you have gathered anything in the letter to the Romans, send it to me through Rellicanus.I have never handled it so far in a sermon, but I will take it up soon.If you have anything to send to me from that time I left, Rellicanus should be used.
